raw_results.original: At the Parc des Champions of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, medal celebration ceremonies aren't just about the current competition. At the Trocadéro, indeed, reallocations of medals from previous Olympics are organized. Set up at the instigation of Martin Fourcade, an influential member of the Paris 2024 Athletes' Commission, they concerned the Beijing 2022 Olympic Winter Games this Wednesday. After a doping affair, the Japanese team, initially bronzed, was notably awarded a silver medal. Two and a half years after the event, the skaters finally received their medals. During the press conference held at the TEAM JAPAN HOUSE, the Japanese expressed their delight: "The ceremony at the Trocadéro was impressive, with lots of people and the Eiffel Tower was also spectacular. The atmosphere was completely different from when we won the skating competition! So I was extremely excited," explained one of the medal winners. I'm very happy that the team was able to get together again and finally receive these medals,"

Alekna threw a 69.97m with his second throw which beat his father’s record of 69.89m.
